name: 朱莉·科昂
awards: 2019年 第91届奥斯卡金像奖 最佳纪录长片 (提名) 大法官金斯伯格
2019年 第71届美国导演工会奖 最佳纪录片导演 (提名) 大法官金斯伯格
introduction: Julie Cohen (nickname Jewels) is an actress, songwriter, singer and casting director.[1][2] She is from New York City. She started her acting career from the stages of Broadway and later at The High School of Performing Arts near Times Square.[1] Cohen is known for Once Upon a Time in America (1984), Thanksgiving in the Land of Oz (1980) and Streetwalkin (1985). Presently she lives in Topanga Canyon, California.[2] She used to write songs for her band City Fritter. City Fritter was disbanded in 2012, she and her husband Johnny changed the band's name to Jewels and Johnny Nation and she writes and sings for this band mainly around her hometown.[1] Cohen studied improvisation at Second City in Chicago.[1]
